Title: Clam AntiVirus: Denial of Service vulnerability
Synopsis:
Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack when processing
    certain Quantum archives.

Background.Text: Clam AntiVirus is a GPL anti-virus toolkit, designed for integration with mail servers to perform attachment scanning. Clam AntiVirus also provides a command line scanner and a tool for fetching updates of the virus database.

Description.Text: Andrew Toller and Stefan Kanthak discovered that a flaw in libmspack's Quantum archive decompressor renders Clam AntiVirus vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service by sending a specially crafted Quantum archive to the server.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
All Clam AntiVirus users should upgrade to the latest available
    version:
